name: RetroBitTechnology
text: They'll hire you on the spot. So if you need a job, this probably is the easiest place to be what can only be described as secretary work in a sudo cop uniform

name: Brian Pike
text: I have been working with Dynamic Security for almost 7 years. I started as a part time officer and worked my way up on many different posts and positions. One of the best things about the company is that I have never felt like a number or just a warm body. I feel like I matter to my supervisors.

name: Mandy Wilson
text:
Dynamic Security is a horrible place to work...I have had experience workinig with this company and they are very shady.  The good officer like Howard johnson whom they made a Captain then took it away from him and gave the position to a black male and did not give him a reason even though he had been there for years.
I know several officers there who were late, slept on duty did not do their patrols but was in good with the field managers so they were never replaced but the good ones who were always early and filled in were harrassed.

name: Joshua Watson
text: Good place to work

name: jeremy shepherd
text: These are some shadey people. I have been removed from one post for illegitimate reasons. And just yesterday I was removed and replaced and never given a reason. That and requesting new uniforms... I asked for new pants for my uniform due to a hand sized hole along the seam about two months ago and still haven't heard anything back from them.  All in all not the best company to work for.

name: RetroBitTechnology
text: They'll hire you on the spot. So if you need a job, this probably is the easiest place to be what can only be described as secretary work in a sudo cop uniform

name: Jody Harris
text: Wonderful they made me feel important and they understood my needs.

name: Chelsea Diamond
text: This company is horrible they tell you they are taking over your location and that they will do everything they can to hire you but then they can't even call you to let you know they don't need you

name: Yvonne Kimbrough
text: I work there

name: tiffany rogers
text: I wish I had an option to leave a negative star review because, that’s what’s truly deserved. The office will do anything they can to make money off you. If that means in my case working a 24 hour shift or, the several 17 plus hour shifts they will. Also when you are short handed because someone has a death in the family except the supervisor to laugh about it. Not only that when they have an employee sexually harass you and, another telling people where you live they will brush it off (even if it is reported locally or even to corporate ) . If you respect yourself or your sanity don’t apply. The people in charge are disgusting excuses for human beings. I honestly wouldn’t wish any position at that company on my worst enemy.

name: MultiplesOfNico
text:
Whoever is calling for interviews is a jerk.

Was immediately disrespected by a male. Not sure what his name but he straight up told me "I don't seem interested" and proceeded to make fun of me over the phone. Also kept cutting me off when I was trying to talk.

Not calling back to set up a interview with this guy.

name: KillaH Harris
text: How u can't get paid for taking vacation days but u can get a vacation check, but there is no vacation policy, pay your employees even the ones from the previous company that ussa bought out, last I check when you buy a company you also buy their debt now pay what y'all (ussa) owes. Seems like a good way to lose a contract

name: Megan Mathews
text: Love my job, and the company! It's been wonderful working for US Security these past few months.

name: Tyrone Berry
text: They lie in your face and the are breaking laws in the process. EEOC may not like that

name: Jason Brosius
text: Terrible employer, terrible employee relations, and terrible service

name: Rod Cooper
text: Very unorganized.

name: Jessie Thompkins
text: Best job

name: Cam Carter
text: Terrible

name: jlo hill
text: Employees were great from the time we entered and left.  Going again next week with more people.  Great atmosphere.

name: Lashunda Dunn
text: Decent officers

name: Robert Samuel
text: I did a interview at the Hoover office for a arm office at the hospital HR told me that they had to send my DD214 to the head office so they could read it since it’s was dated in the the 70s HR told me that he would give me a call at the end of that day and let me know what the head office decided about give me the job in the hospital as a arm office I have my pistol permit and High school  diploma  And I have a honable discharge HR never did call me I call him a week later after the interview he tell me that he had email me I check my email and it said that I wasn’t  qualified to be a arm office for G4’s with no reason why  G4s sucks and just a waste of time and gas going to their interview

name: Jeremy Fisher
text: Great quality protection services

name: James Williams
text: I'm a new employee and in training to become a security guard and get my Alabama security guard license.

name: David Morgan
text: Awesome place to work

name: Julio Zee
text: Terrible company to work for. They lose contracts left &right. It's a buddy system, they give promotions based off of their friends. Terrible GM,  Ops Manager and HR is absolutely a joke. My two cousins lost their jobs because G4S cannot keep contracts. The Hoover office needs to be wiped and start over fresh. Stay far away from this company. They will screw you over, they don't even try to keep their contracts. The Hell with this company😣😣😣

name: Robert Jackson
text: Corruption at the highest levels.  They lie about pay all the time,  they leak and share your personal information like SSN , pay rate, address for anyone to see it. They cheat us officers on deployment pay all the time.  Worst security company ever.  They are sued left and right. Hell they are being sued by SCAD in Savannah GA because of Identity Theft.  They shared personal officers information . Exposed their social security numbers and everything.

name: Kevin Williams
text: Great company to work for!

name: Rod Cooper
text: Poor management, Lack of communication, low pay and your previous experience doesnt matter.

name: Billy Newsome
text: Job fingerprints

name: Brian Lombardino
text: I would highly recommend this company.  The staff is professional, responsive, and reliable.  The director of operations, Jarrett, has always followed through with any and all of our security needs.  They made a promise to protect us and they have followed through with that promise.

name: Rachael Meckl
text: Trident Security is hands down the best in the business. They are reliable, honest, and dependable. All of the security guards are professional and take pride in the service they provide. Everyone that works for Trident are all extremely responsive and they will take the time to listen and make sure your security needs are handled. I appreciate their willingness to take on any job, no matter how big or small. If you are looking for a security company that will give you peace of mind, Trident Security should be your number one choice!

name: Gena Crook
text: Two guards from Trident worked for us at a local neighborhood swimming pool July 4th event.  This event is heavily attended every year.  Trident provided peace of mind for all of us in the parking lot and on the pool grounds.  The guards were friendly and professional.  In addition to  unobtrusively keeping a watch for safety issues the guards also gave us advice on how to improve the general safety of our pool facility.  We will definitely be hiring them again in the future when crowds are expected at pool events.

name: William Tranter
text: Jeff Still and Trident Security Solution worked with the Whitman - Hanson Regional School District to review school safety and security procedures and policies. The professionalism and knowledge of Mr. Still provided our administrative team with specific and cost effective ways to enhance our security protocols. We are very pleased with the working relationship we have built with Trident Security Solution.

name: Jay Rainey
text: The security consulting and training exercises conducted for our staff by Trident Security Solutions are making our school safer for students by preparing our faculty and staff for potential crisis situations. Trident’s decades of experience in security solutions are a great asset to the North Alabama community, and I am looking forward to our continued partnership.

resp.text: Thank you Mr. Rainey. We are proud to be working with an organization so dedicated to their safety and security. We look forward to supporting you into the future.

name: Mary Kate Schonhoff
text: Most professional Security company I have ever worked with!

name: Claudis Brown
text: They get the job done every time.

name: Patrick Coiner
text: I am educated and after my retirement from Active Army I moved directly into law enforcement. Afterwards, Corporate Security and then with Securitas as a Security Officer. I have been treated with dignity and respect from our client as well Securitas Leadership Teams with very little to say negatively. There are issues I have encountered with Securitas. However, our Supervisor has made it her professional mission in life to take care of her officers and our client. She is determined to keep "outstanding" her watchword. I am very enthused and upbeat with how we are making a difference. One Team; One Fight; One Future.

name: Robert Grace
text: Securitas is one of the best companies I’ve ever worked for. Being retired and on social security. This job has been a ideal supplement to my income. The staff you work with are a majority of retirees. So they come from all backgrounds. In addition there are a lot of military veterans. All of this spells responsible and mature. The management does back flips to help you out in scheduling and support. This is my first security position and I feel we get a tremendous amount of respect from our clients and all we come in contact with daily. The trust and confidence our clients gives us is truly one reason I enjoy and feel my job is important.

name: Erica Wright
text: I've worked security for a couple of companies over the years and it's my experience that there are issues across the industry. We don't get paid what we deserve to get paid, are frequently required to go above and beyond with little in the way of recognition, etc. But Securitas at least makes the effort to make sure we feel valued. They work with us with personal issues, and always try to have our backs with the clients. I've definitely worked for worse companies and I genuinely enjoy my work with Securitas, and the people employed with them, even if I wish the pay was better.

name: Jessica Halstrom
text: I’ve worked for this company for 5 years. I’ve never had an issue. Everyone in the office is very nice and they know me by name when I walk in the door. I am always paid on time and without error. Great company to work for :)

name: John
text: I have really enjoyed my time working for Securitas USA! They are a fantastic provider of security officers and their administration is top-notch! 10/10 would recommend to anyone looking for full or part-time positions!

name: Javion Drish
text: I am a current intern for Securitas Security USA and I love it here. I have learned so much since I began my internship this past August. The staff here is great and I look forward to everything that my internship will continue to bring.

name: Joe
text: I worked for this company for 4 1/2 years and There's no amount of money that could make me work for them again. This company does not value their employees. For the first 3 years I had to meticulously count and keep track of my hours because if it wasnt every single paycheck it was every other paycheck that was screwed up...complaining about a problem doesn't help anything...I had one raise in 4 and a half years and it wasn't due to my outstanding performance...it was because they raised starting pay..I caught an arsonist..didn't get so much as a letter of recognition for putting my life on the line for this company...Taxes are due at the end of this month and I still have not received my tax papers....and this has happened every year..I don't suggest going into the security business but if you do I would highly advise you to avoid Securitas.

name: Rafael Lewis
text: Securitas is a great company to work for! I have been working for a year now and I have no problems with my fellow employees. I never had any problem with my pay. I'll recommend anyone to work for them!!!!!!

name: dovahkiin 89
text: They let me go and didn't say anything about why they fired me but it was some great people I work with

name: Loretta Neaves
text: 40 years - paid on time - only recall one payroll error which was corrected the next week - good support from supervision - uniforms when I need them - appropriate training material to develop professional officers – equal opportunity – not a lot of opportunity for promotion, that however is the nature of the contract security world.

name: Barb Costello
text:
Professional interaction with the office staff.
Convenience of meeting times with management in the office.  Overall pleased with experience.

name: Marva Myrics
text: Excellent company to work for. Good training,comparable pay, and opportunity for . advancement.

name: Eunice Bell
text: I’ve been with Securitas for 7 years now, and they are a great company.

name: Brandi Washington
text: I’ve been with them for 5 years and have had a variety of sites.... they’re always dependable and accommodating

name: Mike Goins
text:
retired
20 years sales and sales management
Major account experience
district manager with 8 sales reps

dependable and loyal

name: Andrew Stephens
text:
Don't plan on getting paid on time.
You will have really shity supervisors, you will be fired for makeing complaints.Management is extremely homophobic, as well as completely useless in any regard.

name: Sandra Stone
text: i loved the job but when you get fired over a dam 20oz green tea that is taking alittle to far and i cant even get my unemoyment because of that

name: L*ndy89
text: Not a good company to work for

name: Cody Hardin
text: Stupid

name: ComicReader93
text: Terrible company to work for. As an armed security officer, you get no insurance benefits. If you ask the "Head Supervisor" about insurance, he will tell you "We have insurance, but it is too high." He doesn't give you a price. The site manager, who is under the head supervisor, will write you up if you don't work on your off days. There were a lot of complaints about this shift manager by employees to the "Head Supervisor", but he refused to listen. If your relief doesn't show up, you are forced to work their shift until the next relief shows up 8 hours later. Don't waste your time with this company.

name: Jerry Penton
text: Decent company to work for, each site has different pay rates so your pay depends on the site you work. No issues regarding pay and yes they do direct deposit. You keep it professional they keep it professional. ESRB classes for licenses are done and completed in a timely manner and provided to you. Overall one of the better security companies in the area I've worked for.

name: John Avery
text: Cool people just low pay, I worked 50+ hours just to get a check over $300. If the pay was better then I'll be a lot happier because a $7.25 hour post is unacceptable

name: Nancy Conner
text: Don't work there. They are completely UNprofessional! Don't hire them to "protect" your company IF you value it. IF they happen to get good employees that actually do their job properly, they do everything in their power to get rid of them. There's too much gossip and backstabbing among the office staff. Too Many "mistakes" by the payroll clerk when you're on her (s)hit list - such as not being paid for the hours you work, regular hours and overtime. Being charged for the license the Alabama Security Regulatory Board requires you to carry to be an officer and NEVER receiving it. This license is part of Homeland Security and very necessary. This is just the surface of the problems in and with this company. It's the joke of the local security companies. People who've worked there say, "Go to Eagle. They'll hire ANYONE!!!".

name: Stacy “Shaferslady” Shafer
text: Amazing ppl and service.. nothing to worry about with them in charge of your belongings or ppl..

name: Jeff R.
text: Pay could be better than $8.50 an hour

name: Deejorno
text: Unorganized, unprofessional, no direct deposit, doesn't issue weapons. Sent me to an armed post unarmed I see why SEI has supriority over this company.

name: JP
text: Professional security business. Security officers are well trained and very dependable.

name: Jason Shafer
text: Good folks

name: Shane Lowe
text: I can’t.... just No!!

name: Damian Witt
text: They suck

name: J LaPointe
text: Workable Solutions, LLC exceeded my expectations with Unarmed and Armed Security Officer training.  This is a top notch training company; the facility was clean, organized, and well laid out.  The staff was competent, knowledgeable and experienced.  I enjoyed both classes very much; it was an honor to be taught by instructors of such high caliber.  I plan on returning for additional training!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words. We aim to please. Hope to see you again.

name: Robert Williams
text: Great place to work

name: Loyd Jenkins
text: Best training company around!

name: Niki Butts
text: Amazing group of professionals. Very well trained and extremely knowledgeable. You definitely know you are in good hands with Severance Security Services.

name: Hill Elliott
text: Had a very pleasant experience w Tracy at Severance. She helped us with an issue we had quickly and effectively. Their customer service is phenomenal. Thanks severance!

resp.text: Thank you so much Hill, we appreciate you sir

name: Robyn Houghton
text: Severance security is a group of excellent highly trained, personable, professionals. You’ll find them all over Pensacola from the fair, to the clubs downtown, to special events. These guys are phenomenal. Anytime they are working an event that I’m attending, I automatically feel at ease knowing that I can relax because they are on site. Thanks Severance, for keeping me, my friends and my kids save while we are out enjoying the gulf coast. I appreciate each of you. Please be safe out there.

resp.text: Thank you so much Robyn for the kind words and the great review, but more importantly thank you for your time posting the review. I will show this at our next team meeting. We really appreciate you Robyn.

name: michael cannon
text:
Severance Security is an amazing company with amazing agents! Everyone is very professional! The owner and his personnel go the extra mile and then some! If you need security in Alabama, Florida, and The South, Severance Security is the company to go with! They really took care of us!

Choose Severance!

-Michael Cannon
Owner
S2 Security
Huntington Beach, CA

name: Cerberus Dynamic Solutions
text: I spent the weekend with Severance owner Tim, let me just say he's legit. His company is ran by a moral code backed by quite professionals who have all served this nation. He completely understands the industry and is breaking molds on how to better serve clients. Most security companies are merely a security system sign in the front yard with no system to back it up, with Severance you get the best the industry has to offer and can rest easy knowing your secure. Tim thankyou for your guidance and friendship, I look forward to future business ventures.

name: Jay Estes
text: Folks, if you need security services for any situation and at any level, these are the people to call.  We had a security issue that required armed security and a high level of surveillance and Severance went WAY above and beyond.  Their professionalism and level of expertise in their field is beyond measure.  They went out of their way to make a very difficult situation much more manageable and at no point did I feel concerned for my safety when these guys were around.  Outstanding job Severance.  While I hope I don't need you again any time soon under similar circumstances you can bet your bottom dollar I will call you if I do.  Thank you so much!!

name: Ryan Atkin
text: When choosing a security company, it’s important to work with the BEST! I’m very impressed with Severance Security Services. Their professionalism & expertise is apparent in everything they do. I’m a client for life! Thanks so much to the entire team at Severance!

resp.text: Thank you Ryan , we love having those "Miami Problems"...

name: Paul Lawrence
text: Severance is great company.. I can't say enough about the level of experience they have aborad their staff. I can breath a bit easier knowing that these guys are on the job. They take their craft very seriously on and off duty.

resp.text: Thank you so much sir

name: keith styron
text: Severance provides security to our group when we travel to Gulf Shores. They are professional and take care of all the details.

resp.text: Thank you sir

name: Kyle Murray
text: Severance Security provides a security solution that is second to none.  This team is built of Military Vetrans, very professional group.

resp.text: Thank you sir

name: Joel Maxson
text: You will be protected.

name: Vagner Cascaes
text: I dealt with the management team and the staff and everyone was professional and ethical.

resp.text: Thank you sir

name: Mike Beasley
text: It is one of the most professional business es I've had the pleasure to work for. All they expect is take pride in your work and do your job and I can't wait till I return shortly. No exaggerated  or blowing smoke, it is a great company and great leadership.

name: Stormy Hammer
text: Great company, extremely dependable, very punctual with their job. Highly recommend!

name: Video Good
text:
Outstanding company to work with. We had an employee threaten other employees. Bill was able to get us 2 armed security guards same day to protect our facility this week. A+++ Thank YOU!
Brian Gielman- Video Productions Alabama

name: G. Robin Pruitt, Jr
text: They did an incredible job providing protective service personnel for my needs. Always on time. Always flexible with scheduling. Would highly recommend for any needs you might have.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words. It was a pleasure providing security for you. We are here if you ever need us again. 🙏

name: Matthew Johnson
text: I've been working with Patriot Services Group off and On for 2 yrs now. They Are upstanding people. The Officers have been reliable and always courteous. I have no problems recommending them.

name: Troy Sigma chi
text: Patriot Services Group offered very competitive prices with top quality security guards. We were very satisfied with their services!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind review. it was a pleasure doing business with you as well. Please don't hesitate to contact us again for security services...

name: HofL Church - Alabama
text: What a great experience with Patriot.  We originally contacted them for a quote for a situation at our church.  Though they responded quickly we decided to have the Birmingham Police handle the situation instead of a private security company.  The following day Patriot followed up with us to see how things went. They did not get the business, yet they were concerned enough to follow up.  I told them we used the Birmingham Police instead and they told us if we ever needed them, they were there for us.  This was powerful and left quote an impression on us. Therefore, the following week, when we needed security, we called Patriot. They were professional, thorough and timely. They assigned Officer Demarcus to us.  The next day when we arrived Officer Demarcus was already there, outside, ready to go. He was attentive, followed our instructions to the letter and very focused.  He was present without being obvious. Our members wanted to know there was security but they did not want to be reminded that we needed security. Officer Demarcus did an excellent job and put our members at ease with his low key, competent demeanor.  Our overall experience was extremely positive and we were put completely at ease during an unfortunate situation.   We will continue using Patriot and recommend them to one and all!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words and review. We appreciated having the opportunity to serve your Church and will certainly pass on your review to Demarcus :)  God Bless You All..

name: Danielle Grice
text:
Couldn't have been any better
Great job would recommend to anyone

resp.text:
Thank you Danielle for your kind review  Was a pleasure working with you on your security project.
- W. Prosser CEO.

name: Fred Butler
text: Very Professional and Polite Staff & Technicians. Have what it takes to correct and remedy the worst previously installed and/or Inadequate equipment or provide you with new equipment. Gorrie-Regan is Truely at the Top of the Industry.

name: Fred Butler
text: Top of the line equipment, Great Company, The Best group of Technicians available, Very Professional.

name: Michael Hargrove
text: Pleasant, friendly and both office workers(Aimee and Leah)  are very helpful.

name: Tyler Alexander Bickford
text: Signal 88 is great company to work for they got a great team they very professional at what they do

name: Mark Robertson
text: The guards were well trained and I was able to reach a local manager to address any changes that needed to be made. Great service!

name: Demetria Pearl
text: Highly satisfied.  Signal 88 was referred by an acquaintance on short notice, and management set everything up on short notice.  The guards were prompt and very professional.  Very happy with service and will continue to use them for the foreseeable future.

name: Robert Welch
text: This place is vary horrible DO NOT WORK HERE poor management shows favortism and very unclear on schedules as well as they leave you in bad situations and the quote sergents tell you they dont have time for your problem your having they tell you if you have to use any force for a situation then you'll have to deal with everthing on your own i work or worked for this undercutting underpaying company i havent heard anything from them un weeks now and their app is screwing up my phone and they condone people fallung asleep at their post as if their there for nothing

name: Jacob C
text: Used to work for them. Technically still do since none of the managers like to get in touch with their employees or keep their word. I was layed off, i tried getting in touch with managers and supervisors about work several times. Even said they would contact me, i get nothing. Probably 3 or 4 months later here i am, still nothing. Not even a call asking for a resignation, even though i was probably the most loyal employee that they had. There was this "supervisor" i had, who would come and check on me, i believe his name was Mike, he got caught at home while on the clock , while he was supposed to be on duty checking on fellow security guards. To make sure they were at their post. And he got in trouble on multiple occassions. It took forever until discipline action was taken and he just got demoted. Then promoted again. Then demoted again. I worked hard and did what i was told. Showed up on time. And this is what the result is. So everyone, i do not recommend these unproffesional people.

name: Brain Trust
text: Very pleased with Signal 88 of Mobile!  Guards were very efficient and we had no incidents during the time frame that we needed security.

name: Justin Farmer
text: We had Signal 88 Security of Mobile conduct video surveillance for our business in relation to a private investigation case.  The results were amazing and I would recommend them to anyone wanting security services!

name: Sarah Wright
text: Poor communication skills. Very hard to contact unless current employee

name: Tony Hester
text: Sorry communication

name: Dale Williams
text: I actually visited a church located in the same building.

name: Wesley Hulgan
text: Out of all of the jobs I’ve had this one has had to be the least desirable/stable places I’ve ever worked, was promised pay raise I never received, was expected to work on a moments notice (on off days) with the answer “no” or “I can’t” not being acceptable,was told I wasn’t doing my job when I did things down to a T  as I was instructed and when I was told I was doing wrong I was never given better or clearer instructions. If your looking for a few quick checks this is a place for you to do so but your not gonna have a good chance of building on any sort of career here. Not to mention I’ve also seen their star pupils dead asleep in their cars mid shift but I’m glad I didn’t go out of my way to help THEM.

name: Cuinn Horowitz
text: If you're looking for something that can actually pay the bills, don't look here. You work 50 hours in a week and get 25 on the next paycheck. They pay 5 bucks less than industry standard then cut your hours as they see fit. In my last week I was working 3 hours a day. How is that livable?

name: Lisa Bentley
text: The company does not respect their employees. They fire the great employees that are doing their job, and bring on new ones that sleep on the job, or leave 3 hours early to go sit the remainder of their shift at Waffle House.

name: Lewis Ledbetter
text: Great management, family ran. They are all very close and work well together. Working for them makes you feel like you’re apart of the family as well. Very flexible, if you’re in school or have other obligations. Very fun, I’ve met so many people and had some great laughs and experiences since I’ve started.

name: stacie vanwagner
text:
This is a great place to work. Especially if you are looking to supplement your income. Flexible hours and competitive pay. I like the variety of events and establishment that we get to work security at. All the coworkers and management are really nice and easy to get along with.
Unlike a-lot of places we get paid weekly which helps a-lot of people working a full time job as well, make it to their full time paycheck.
I work part time hours but still am afforded a break during my shift to be able to call home and check on my family which is a must do for me.Glad I found Southern Jamm and thankful for my job with them.

name: Danny Turner
text: I've worked for Southern Jamm for almost a year and I love it! Larry and Melanie have treated me very well. I work in environments that are very exciting. The people I work with are fun to be around. I feel good at the end of the day because I know that I kept people safe and property secure.

name: Nathan Colley
text: I've worked with Southern Jamm for about 6 months now. Larry, the owner, runs a tight ship. I have a lot of respect for him because of it. Naturally, the owner and supervisors expect you to act mature and professional when representing the company, which is easy when you realize the work you do matters and is important. If you can't do that, move along. All in all, its rewarding work. I've been glad to have the opportunity to get some part time work in on the side here.

name: Shawn Wheeler
text: Professionalism is a priority, along with caring for their employees. Looking forward to spending many years working with this friendly, family-run company.

name: Carlos Lamar
text: Great security company in making my events feel secure. Customers leave comments about the polite security guards in helping out. Southern Jamm Security secured my building, parking lot, and even the hotel across.

name: Lindie Cartagena
text: Good management good company to work for very understanding people.

name: Judy May
text: At The Huntsville Havoc game and there are quite of few from this company walking around. A few of these are kids and not sure they could help out if anything broke out. I honestly do not remember seeing them here in the past.

name: Chadwick Towry
text: Love working here. Great people. Meet alot of people

name: Mark Jones
text: Alot of verbal harassment and to many shoulders rubbs . For a security company they have kids from 16 to 19 years old working security for grown adults. They are untrained and have no clue what they are doing. I know more then 20 people who worked for these guys and they either tell me they were uncomfortable , violated or just straight up disrespected by someone with in the business. This is not even accounting for the reviews of the people who had to deal with these guys. Its a accepting applications sign outside for a reason.

name: C Lamar
text: Love working here and going to all the events. Larry and Melanie are good people to work for.

name: Tammy Mills Shaughnessy
text: I have had contact with the owner or manager as an job interviewer and as a customer at my gas station. He is flat out rude, pompous and entitled.  I really don't know how he stays in business. It must be due to little to no competition. Uugghhhh. Grow up.

name: Cody Ward
text: Great Company to work for. Very professional and serious about what they do.

name: B Mutph
text: The guards they have now are professional and seem to be trained

name: Patty Arra
text: Always feel safe with SJS

name: David Murphy II
text: Its a great security company.

name: Jason Viator
text: GSI is a company on the move. They are a top notch integrator and industrial cabling provider for the gulf area. Their customer base includes large corporations as well as local companies that trust them implicitly with their access control and monitoring. Good people make it what it is....and it is amazing!

name: Crystal Kilpatrick
text: A lot of negative reviews are outdated and from upset past employees. GSI has greatly improved as of late with a stronger and much more skilled team. Positive changes are happening that have improved the business overall!

name: Bryan Goodrich
text: I was recently employed by GSI for a short time, unfortunately, a family situation forced me to relocate. While I was employed at GSI I received an invaluable amount of training and support. I feel GSI is cultivating a very professional and family oriented culture. GSI strives for excellence as a company and encourages thier employees to do the same.

resp.text: Thanks for the kind words Bryan - you're missed!

name: Jackie Jolliffe
text: Dropped off some goodies for ians coworkers for christmas

name: Fred Butler
text: Great Local Security Company, Can meet or exceed all your Security needs,

name: Fred Butler
text: Momma said if you dont have nothing nice to say. Keep it to yourself.

name: Cindy Donovan
text: Not good people.    Beware doing business with them.

name: Fishing Diva
text: Always a pleasure. I'm an ex-employee son home from college for the summer got him a job on the spot.

name: Jeff Naylor
text: Just wanted to provide a positive rating and review for the Golden Eagle security folks. As a lifelong Tallahasseean and top production real estate professional that needs access into Golden Eagle often, the security officers have been courteous and responsive. I have the utmost confidence in their abilities and happy to let prospective buyers know the same.

name: Charles Hice
text: Apparently your Company is using the Church Parking lot for the BUilding I will try to avoid the area in the future. Have a nice day.

name: Honey Badger
text: Tried numerous times too get in touch with someone about a job over a time span of 6 weeks. They just kept telling me to message a different supervisor every time. They don’t have the guts too make a phone call. Great way to treat your Veterans guys. Don’t waste your time with this company.

name: Jordan Safranek
text: The day my grandfather died they gave me write up for not giving them enough time notice for a call in then wanted proof that he died for me to go to his funeral. Even if you call in the 4 hours before your shift and have a Dr excuse they still write you up. The job itself is simple and easy but the management is a joke. They don't care about you as an employee

name: Victoria Lambeth
text: Okay security company to begin and start your career as an security officer especially if you have no experience in the field.They have good employee perks and benefits. They have very flexible shifts and always have multiple job vacancies open in different cities  I absolutely enjoyed working for this employer, however some of Allied Universal Supervisors who manage the clients' sites could definitely improve on their communication skills and try to better understand employees who have disabilities.

name: Ace Temple
text: awful benefits, hard to get time off even when you request a year in advance. high turnover of management and hit/miss whether you get paid correctly.

name: Tasha Davis
text: I love working for this company. The people are friendly and it's a great atmosphere depending on where your post is.

name: Aaron Mewhinney (Momo)
text: As a company they ensure professionalism as well as saftey to property and poeple

name: Reese Ryder
text: This One Particular Person Showed The Best Hospitality I've Ever Seen @ Any Establishment.

name: Steven f
text: Worked at the same post for four years use to be OK despite low pay but recently not getting paid for over time and I think we are on the 7th account manager this year alone

name: Fitzgerald King
text: Best Place to work

name: angela christenson
text: Adam was most helpful!!

name: Joe Tamper
text: Very unprofessional and management is horrible and management take things personal when you are voicing your opinion about certain things and takes u off the schedule

name: Jimmy Fisher
text: I have been working for this awful company for almost 3 months, and I have never had a correct paycheck, and they are over one month behind correcting it as I type this. One paycheck was only 2 dollars when I worked over 40 hours. DO NOT work for this company under ANY circumstances.

name: Jane Dope
text: Not worth the money

name: Willis Marbury
text: Great job recruiting

name: deedee dandridge
text: A very terrible company to work for

resp.text: Hi Deedee, please feel free to send us additional information to info@aus.com about your experience so that we may assist.

name: Jacqueline Haygood
text: Good place to work, they are very flexible.

name: Karen Wright
text:
Good place to work. Good working environment. Our site works very well with just the right people on each shift!
Our site Supervisor is great to work with!

name: Traci Butler
text: Love my job

name: LaQuandria Riggs
text: Great place to work and you can get much overtime as you want.  The supervisors really care about they employee's and will definitely  accommodate your schedule.

name: Sylvester WashingtonII
text: Very easy to find. Top of the line professional services.

name: julian hailey
text: Highest quality security guard provider in Birmingham. Hands down.

name: Sidney Miles
text: Love this place

name: Shaunta Lyles
text: My fiance works for this company

name: Ronnie Butler
text: Good place

name: JT Thomas
text: Good place to work.....Less problems

name: Shannon Braden
text: Its ok

name: Dakota Curren
text: This is truly a great company to work for.  Yes, in the end Jeff and I had our differences in opinion, but what made this stand out more than anything was my number was still on their "call list" which resulted in me getting a call in regards to an employee.  I sent Jeff a message and advised him.  He could have very well just said "Ok" or something along those lines, but he replied back with "Thank You".  Honestly, even with the differences.  I have no negative feelings about this company and would and will recommend them to anyone who wishes to work there.  Jeff has always been a person to take care of his own (team).  He gets out and works post if he has too.  He has been there and done it all.  While there was a lot to be changed during my tenure there, he did what he could at the time to improve.  The clients he meets he develops a great relationship with.  Jeff, I am glad to see things are succeeding for you and wish McDowell Security the very best and continued success.

name: Ruth Jones
text: Very unprofessional! Office staff is disorganized, rude & can never answer an employee’s questions (especially HR dept). The company does not care if you get your correct pay. If you attempt to speak with the owner (Jeff) you will not get him. If you try to make an appointment with the owner you also get put off! He acts like his office staff being rude is not his problem. My family member had to go to the wage & hour board due to the company’s lack of organization. Would not recommend working for them or hiring them! My family member had to call off their shift (first & only time) to take their child to the ER & was asked why they had to be there? We’re they the doctor? They have no empathy or compassion towards anyone! There are also other guards who have had issues with office staff & on site management. Shame on you!

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback regarding our company.  I'm sorry you feel like our office staff was less than helpful.  It has always been our policy in cases of payroll questions to err on the side of the employee when we have no evidence to support the dispute.  We also have never terminated an employee for taking a child to the ER.  I am sure there is more that your "family member" has not told you.

name: Jack Martin
text: They were very polite and helped my grandmother into the car always professional.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback!  We believe customer service is one of the best tools for security!

name: Nicholas Johnson
text: I would highly recommend Jeff and his team at McDowell Security for any event. They are extremely professional and know what they are doing which is more than I can say for other companies we've worked with. Excellent experience and cant wait to work with them again!

name: Hiala Elridge
text: Very rude and unprofessional!!!  My encounter with McDowell security occurred 4.7.19 at the Outlet Shops of Grand River in Leeds, AL and was very unpleasant, unprofessional and unnecessary .  My group of 4 people (2 adults and 3 youth) were approached in the parking lot of the Grand outlet by a male and female in a golf cart as we were walking from our vehicle parked far out in the parking lot.  We were asked if we were attending the Barber Motorsports event and we replied yes, but were going to do some shopping first.  We were told that there were designated parking spaces to catch the bus to attend the Barber Motorsports, but as stated we were going to shop first and then attend the event and we had looked for parking in the designated areas upon 1st arriving and were unable to locate a parking space.  After walking through the Grand Rivers outlet, we approached the gate to head toward the buses.  When approaching the gates, we asked if we were at the correct entrance to board the buses to go to the event, only to find out that the man in the golf cart had contacted security to provide our description and inform them not to let us through the gate until we moved our vehicle!  The security guard stated that our PROFILE met the description of the group that was not parked in the correct location and that he would not let us through until we moved.  This was handled very unprofessionally and the whole incident could have been avoided for the following reasons. 1. AT no point in time did the man in the golf cart tell us that it was MANDATORY, for us to move to get through a gate to board a bus.  2. At no point and Time ever is the Leeds outlet full of cars, ESPECIALLY parked far out,  so our parking would not have inconvenience anyone.  3. We were patrons to the outlet too and were not treated as such.  This was a very disheartening event and not behavior that one would want 1st time youth attending the event to encounter.   Not impressed with McDowell Security!!!!

resp.text: Your complaint should be with Grand River.  It sounds like you were told the rules and decided they did not apply to you.  Anything our employees said to you would have been taken as "rude" and "unprofessional" as I am sure my reply probably is.

name: Ka'Terria Kelly
text: If you need a job to do on the side its a great opportunity to reach out for.

resp.text: Thank you!

name: irene blomenkamp
text: McDowell Security is the best most professional group ever.  I have known Jeff for six years and his company has never disappointed no matter what they have faced

name: Jamie White
text: McDowell Security is an amazing company with an awesome leader. If you are ever in need of security services, I would highly recommend this company!

name: Benjamin Sawyer
text: Jeff and the McDowell team are very professional and also very caring.  They do a great job!

name: Brice Jackson
text: What an amazing company! Trust Jeff & his team of professionals with all your security needs!

name: Cherel Sumerlin
text: They are rude and disrespectful to their workers! I wish I could give them 0 stars.

resp.text: I recall a review you left somewhere else that was praising us.  Why the change of heart?

name: Christen Henry
text: Wonderful company. Very professional.

name: Avis
text: Cheated my daughter out of pay.

resp.text: McDowell Security has a history of ensuring payroll is accurate and on time.  If your daughter feels she was not paid correctly, she should contact our payroll manager and discuss this with them.  If we had an error, we will be more than happy to correct it.

name: Patrick Rhodes
text: Not reliable

resp.text: Please be more specific as to why you are making this claim.

name: Angelica W
text: Staff is very friendly and informative.

name: Phylisha Roberts
text: Unprofessional and rude.   I vote no stars. NOT A FORMER EMPLOYEE.

resp.text: Former employee.

name: Antwon McGhee
text: This company said my background was not right but how when I passed doj background check

resp.text: Any questions regarding a matter on your background check, should be directed to the Alabama Security Regulatory Board.  They ultimately determine the standards for the background check.

name: Aubrie Aubbie
text: Rude and unprofessional

resp.text: Former employee

name: Christopher Hollis
text: Great place
